member.name: T:Eclipse.Configuration.DefaultConfigurationService
member.summary: Service, responsible for providing ways for configuring the game either from the editor, manually during game development, or using in-game settings.
member.remarks:
You might struggle to decide if you should manually implement your settings or use s instead. For that, keep in might rule of thumb:
- if parameter is modifiable at runtime - use .
- if parameter can be modified by other mods at runtime - use .
- if parameter is only set at launch or engine restart - use C# Properties.
- if parameter can be 'set' at runtime, but value will only update after reload - use .

member.name: T:Eclipse.Modding.Mod
member.summary: Class describes all the mod data it can have. AssetBundles, assemblies, and other resources are described here with wrappers around dictionaries and resource addresses.
member.remarks:
For our community mods: you are free to develop mods for the game, but they won't be used in public events before approval. Approval requires you to expose mod code to the public (i.e. via GitHub), and make the last update 2-3 days before the event (in most cases). Our team will go through the code and verify its contents.
If mod was already verified and you have a hotfix - we can make a quick verification, but you need to contact out team for that. This section applies only to those, who's mods were selected for usage in any of the upcoming events.
Keep in mind that ALL the mods that use BepInEx and Harmony will be disqualified outside of the special cases. If your mod is large enough, we will consider verifying it, but otherwise - they won't be accepted. And it doesn't matter that we have a support for BepInEx and Harmony in code - it was made for ease in modding, not for our public events. Refer to the modding guide to grasp all the tools available for you as a mod-maker by default (that's a lot btw, with native C# support, dw)
TL;DR:
- Try to use native modding tools for creating verifiable code instead of BepInEx and Harmony.
- Contact us to request new features.
- BepInEx and Harmony mods wont be accepted (for events) outside of special circumstances. (This message is from Dark)

members.member:
=== === === === === == = - - = == === === === === === . . Extra . === === === === === == = - - = == === === === === ===
Information about CPU caches.
Note: only access this section after has initialized.
It is not recommended to refer to this class in loops and similar. Checking for cache usage every frame will probably consume too much CPU resources. In 99% of cases, you are better off just generally optimize your game - avoid calling Unity API frequently to avoid extern calls and similar. Use this class only to adjust how your systems behave in a long term, by changing references to the methods and functions used, etc. Reliable cache usage optimizations on all possible systems require a lot of expertise and knowledge, so be mindful about how you use data in this section. Good luck.
